title: Quake test for fed. way schools
author: Unknown
text: FEDERAL WAY - The school district's 37 schools generally are in good shape to withstand an earthquake, though some of the district's oldest buildings need further study, an engineering consultant's report say     Rod Leland, district facilities director, said buildings constructed after 1980 posed no concern. But he said some older ones, such as Panther Lake Elementary, require further study to see if features that appear in building plans, such as roof tie-downs and reinforced masonry, actually exist.     Some schools that were built 50 years ago are likely to be seriously damaged in a quake but won't collapse, Leland said.   Leland said most of the buildings are wood-frame and one-story, posing less danger in a quake.   Leland said the report "will give us guidance as to whether or not there's a high enough level of concern about a particular building that would drive us to do a design fix
